ЁЯСС
Accession: Rise to Power

Considered the real founder of the Magadha Empire, Bimbisara established a powerful and stable kingdom through strategic planning. He was also known as Shrenika.

First Indian king to maintain a standing army
ЁЯУЬ
Governance and Administration

He established his capital at Rajgir (Girivraja) and implemented an efficient administrative system with a well-organized method of tax collection.

тЪФя╕П
Conquest and Diplomacy
  • Military Conquest: He conquered the neighboring kingdom of Anga (modern Bhagalpur), boosting Magadha's economy.
  • Matrimonial Alliances: He expanded his influence by marrying Kosaladevi of Kosala (receiving Kashi as dowry), Chellana of Vaishali, and Khema of Madra (Punjab).
  • Diplomacy: He maintained friendly relations with Avanti and sent his royal physician Jivaka to treat King Pradyota's jaundice.
ЁЯПЫя╕П
Culture and Patronage

Bimbisara was a contemporary of both Lord Buddha and Mahavira. He practiced religious tolerance, respected both religions, and donated the 'Veluvana Vihara' to the Buddhist Sangha.
